info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 17 at 10:23AM EST until February 21 at 7:00AM EST by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Indiana... North Branch Elkhart River at Cosperville affecting Noble County. ...The National Weather Service in Northern Indiana has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Indiana...Michigan... Saint Joseph River Michigan at South Bend affecting Elkhart, Berrien and St. Joseph IN Counties. Elkhart River at Goshen affecting Noble and Elkhart Counties. Saint Joseph River Michigan at Niles affecting Elkhart, Berrien and St. Joseph IN Counties. .These river rises will shift ice within the river and could lead to ice jams. This forecast is based on unobstructed flow and does not factor additional rises associated with ice jams. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY MORNING TO MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Elkhart River at Goshen. * WHEN...From Friday morning to Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 7.0 feet, The river reaches flood stage. Goshen, Shanklin, and Rogers Park in Goshen begin to flood. Island, Studebaker, and American Parks in Elkhart begin to flood. At 8.0 feet, Some residential and commercial properties near SR 119 are affected by high water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 AM EST Thursday the stage was 5.7 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage tomorrow morning to 7.7 feet early Saturday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage Sunday morning to 5.9 feet and begin rising again early Tuesday morning. It will rise to 6.2 feet early Wednesday afternoon. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Detailed river forecasts and additional information can be found at www.weather.gov/iwx under Rivers and Lakes. This statement will be updated within the next 12 to 24 hours.
